data.title: step into history
data.text: A guided tour into what President Truman did everyday. You can see his office, old court rooms and learn about our legal history(Prosecution and Defense at the same table). The architecture was beautiful. Then go into another room and see the art work of local painter. Historical splendor in one stop.

data.title: Worth a look
data.text: There is really not much to see here. The building and grounds are nice. My daughter and I happened to stop in on a day that the Jackson County Historical Society was about to do a reenactment of an actual trial. If you have the opportunity, the reenactments are well done. You feel like you have been transported back in time.

data.title: Do not See list.
data.text: This tops my Do Not see list. A statue and a building where Truman was. No interactive displays. You have to go online if you want to read accurate history of the place. It is not located in a nice neighborhood. This is based on my visual observations while I was there and the FBI Crime statistics of the area. .I was the only tourist there. no one  else in sight at 2pm in the afternoon. That should tell you something.Best viewing is a Warm Sunny day.

data.title: Tour of Truman Courthouse
data.text: This was nothing like our expectations.  It is a little room in a gift shop.  Self tour is looking at some pictures on the walls.  Disappointing.

data.title: Overrun w Pokemon Go players
data.text: Beautiful building and old fashioned town square with a dozen or so restaurants and eclectic shops. Every time I walked by the square there have been 50 or more folks walking around staring at their phones chasing Pokemons. Hope they catch some of the history at the square too.

data.title: Excellent Tour!
data.text: The tour of the historic courthouse, Truman court room & office, and art gallery was worth waiting for!  Offered only at 11 and 2, no reservations, tickets or charge.  There were only three people in our tour group, but more would have been fine also.  Only by taking the tour can you get into the various rooms and hear the stories of the courthouse and see the art gallery.  Fascinating!

data.title: Independence Courthouse on the Square
data.text: Truman used to work here and it's an impressive building from outside. It's something to see if you are in the area. I wouldn't go there specifically to see it unless you are a big Truman fan or really interested in Presidential history.

data.title: Great history here
data.text: Loved our tour.  Lots of information about the courthouse and how it grew and was used by the peoples.  Lots of beautiful artifacts and the paintings in the museum are special.

data.title: Nice quick viewing
data.text: The nice historical building right in Independence Square downtown. It's well kept and informative for some of the history of the city. Feel free to stop in and look around it kept very nicely

data.title: Loaded with history
data.text: This is the courthouse that Harry Truman presided as a judge before he became president. Much of the original structure and items are still in this working courthouse. This is also the same square that Bob Dole stood on Election morning at 3 AM in 1996. There are plenty of little shops around the square, but the courthouse is a real treasure. It is neat to stop in and look around for a few minutes if you are close by.

data.title: Nothing Special
data.text:
People who worked in the visitor center in the building were not overly friendly.  They were more interested in getting you to sign their guest book, which of course, translates to more funding for their office.  They really did not want to answer questions, kept insisting that we come back in three hours for their guided tour, which I did not have an open time slot for.  

Walk around the building yourself to see what there is to see.  Also, I found the deputy sitting at the entrance door was far more friendly in answering questions than the so called visitors office.

data.title: Downtown
data.text: Beautiful older courthouse in the square. Truman statue is out front. The grounds are well kept and the building is surrounded with shopping in a quaint area

data.title: Be sure to visit the visitor center here
data.text: This historic courthouse marks the spot where all the western trails started. This is also where Truman had his first government job. Be sure to visit the visitor center here they are very helful and knowable.

data.title: Stop Here First
data.text: Great Info center very informative.We didn't have a lot of time so they pointed out the the best route to see the mostin the time we had

data.title: enjoyable walk
data.text: enjoyed seeing the history around the area, Hard to believe so much is there and little I really new.

data.title: Didn't get to tour...
data.text: Outside is neat. We were passing through town and found this on a brochure. The brochure said it was open 10-4 mon-sat. When we called (arrived at 3), they said they closed at 2 and anything after was by appointment only. Sucks, but neat to see.

data.title: Traffic Docket and Quick Visit
data.text: This is a historic courthouse building having the oldest foundation for its type west of the Mississippi River.   There is an active courtroom and a complete mock up of Harry S Truman's Oval Office.   Other sites are in walking distance as well...

data.title: Great Courthouse
data.text: To see this courthouse fully you need to go on the free tour, which are conducted at 11:00 am and 2:00 PM. The tour takes about one hour.

data.title: quaint and interesting
data.text: A bit of history and quaint little downtown from yesteryear.  Sorry I missed the festival in the area which is around labor weekend.  Not much going on today when I was there

data.title: Nice to see.
data.text: This building was recently renovated and opened to tour, etc.  Love seeing an old time courthouse.  I like the authenticity of it.
